title: Thermodynamics, Statistical Mechanics, Interfacial Phenomena in Living Systems
description: Thermodynamics, statistical mechanics, and interfacial phenomena that emphasize the chemical natures of living systems. Topics include intermolecular and surface forces, calculation of energetic processes, computation of electrical forces and fields, and principles of physics in multiscale engineering and design. Prerequisites: graduate standing in bioengineering or consent of instructor. (W)
